page.title: 13WOOLACOMBE METHODIST CHURCH
page.content: Woolacombe Methodist Church, with its spacious Sunday School Room beneath and adjoining car park, is situated in Beach Road. The first Bible Christian meetings in Woolacombe were held in a loft over the archway next to Woolacombe Dairy, reached by a ladder. Later their services were held at Barton Farm where Mr & Mrs Thomas Beer were the tenants. In 1889 a Bible Christian Mission Hall was built. The present Methodist Church was built in 1893. As with the Methodist Church at Mortehoe, it is included in the Ilfracombe Circuit. The present membership is 22.
